Key Match Events: Francisco Lindor hit a walk-off walk in the 8th pitch duel against Devin Williams, giving the Mets a reason to believe.
Pete Alonso hit a go-ahead, three-run homer in the 8th inning.
Starling Marte added an insurance RBI single.
Brice Turang hit a one-hopper at Lindor, who took it to the bag and fired to first.
Pre-Game Insights: The Mets had to win the do-or-die NL Wild Card Game 3 to advance to the playoffs.
The team had a bad bullpen in May, but the president of baseball operations, David Stearns, fixed it by acquiring new players.
Post-Match Reflections: The Mets president of baseball operations, David Stearns, said that Lindor has spent the season showing there is no at-bat too big for him.
Brandon Nimmo said that Lindor is a professional, inside and out, and that was a professional at-bat.
Jose Cohen said that when Lindor drew the walk, he thought to himself, 'You know, we could pull this thing out.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mets won their first playoff series since taking the 2015 pennant.
They were off to Philadelphia for the Division Series.
This is all being done with Lindor as the best player â€” arguably having the finest positional year in franchise history.
